name: insolvable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a problem, difficulty, or mystery is insolvable, it is not possible to find a solution to it or the cause of it. : He had the confidence to address problems that many people considered insolvable. I spent a long time thinking about the mystery, but found it insolvable.
More examplesFewer examplesThey spent many hours together debating insolvable theological dilemmas.Rather than dismissing this as an insolvable problem, perhaps we should look at it from a different angle.This conflict has dragged on for years and is starting to appear insolvable.She has found a brilliant solution to a seemingly insolvable puzzle.
